hotspot.description: Modern, 55,000-capacity sports stadium & concert venue offering behind-the-scenes guided tours. https://capetownstadium.co.za/
hotspot.title: Cape Town Stadium

hotspot.description: Signal Hill, or Lion's Rump, is a landmark flat-topped hill located in Cape Town, next to Lion's Head and Table Mountain. The hill was also known as "The Lion's Flank", a term now obsolete. Together with Lion's Head, Signal Hill looks like a lion sphinx.
hotspot.title: Signal Hill

hotspot.description: Lion's Head is a mountain in Cape Town, South Africa, between Table Mountain and Signal Hill. Lion's Head peaks at 669 metres above sea level. The peak forms part of a dramatic backdrop to the city of Cape Town and is part of the Table Mountain National Park.
hotspot.title: Lion's Head

hotspot.description: Table Mountain is a flat-topped mountain forming a prominent landmark overlooking the city of Cape Town in South Africa. It is a significant tourist attraction, with many visitors using the cableway or hiking to the top.
hotspot.title: Table Mountain

hotspot.description: The 35-room Queen Victoria Hotel is where classic elegance meets contemporary design. It is a haven of calm, luxury and understated opulence in the midst of the hustle and bustle of Cape Town’s popular V&A Waterfront. Its interiors are characterised by marble-clad walls, crystal chandeliers, and wooden parquet flooring. There is also a triple-volume foyer with a dramatic white spiral staircase and a glass lift. The signature shade of deep purple has been employed to add a touch of regal eccentricity as a tribute to Queen Victoria. This hotel possesses both international flair and a local flavour, which is not only apparent in the interiors, but also in the bar and restaurant, where local ingredients are used to create classic French cuisine. Also on offer are spa and gym facilities, a pool, a manicured garden as well as facilities for the disabled. With a management team and staff dedicated to making every guest feel like royalty, a stay at the Queen Victoria Hotel will certainly exceed your expectations of what five-star luxury should be like. https://newmarkhotels.com/places/hotels/victoria-alfred-hotel/
hotspot.title: Queen Victoria Hotel & Manor House

hotspot.description: This elegant 103-room hotel is situated right next door to the Commodore Hotel in the V&A Waterfront, and it offers guests (leisure and business) both superior accommodation and a relaxed atmosphere. The staff have a uniquely personal approach to service. One of the memorable features of this historical hotel is that the restaurant and lobby are built around the original well and the holding cells for prisoners on their way to Robben Island 300 years ago. The hotel honours this history and provides guests with a unique experience. It lies within walking distance of the many attractions of the Waterfront. The Quarter Kitchen is famous for its breakfasts and its Cape Malay dishes. Among the many facilities available are a terrace, a cocktail bar, the business centre, a babysitting service, conferencing facilities and a travel desk. https://www.legacyhotels.co.za/hotels/portswood-hotel
hotspot.title: The PortsWood Hotel

hotspot.description: The Dock House Hotel offers discerning guests, visiting dignitaries and celebrity’s exclusive accommodation, as well as personalised yet unobtrusive butler-style service in a unique world-class setting. Originally built as the Harbour Master’s private residence in the 1800s, this grand architectural gem has been transformed into one of Cape Town’s most exclusive and elegant boutique hotels. Here, understated grace meets contemporary-classical glamour: from the lovely gardens surrounding the elegant outdoor swimming pool and bar area, to the well-appointed interior, which boasts five plush bedrooms, a spacious suite, a spa, an elegant breakfast room and a private library. This hotel is particularly known for its attention to detail and its attentive in-room dining service. https://newmarkhotels.com/places/hotels/dock-house-boutique-hotel/
hotspot.title: The Dock House Hotel

hotspot.description: Legacy’s flagship hotel, the elegant Commodore Hotel provides stylish facilities, a tranquil setting and quality service to all its visitors. It is situated alongside the V&A Waterfront, in the heart of Cape Town, within walking distance of the eateries and entertainment on offer in the Mother City. The stunning views and superior setting set this luxury 236-room hotel apart. The rooms, ranging from luxury rooms to family rooms offer all the amenities a business travel or a vacationing guest could expect. Facilities include a the popular Clipper Restautant, a banqueting venue, a health and wellness centre, a gym, a valet service, a cocktail bar and lounge, 24-hour room service, secretarial services and several meeting and function rooms. There is a reason why guests return year after year to this centrally situated and stylish hotel. https://www.legacyhotels.co.za/hotels/commodore-hotel
hotspot.title: The Commodore Hotel

hotspot.description: The Silo Hotel is a magical space towering above the V&A Waterfront – an extraordinary hotel that sets a new standard in luxury travel and service. It is surrounded by the ocean, the mountain and this remarkable Mother City and offers guests a choice between several spacious and elegant suites. There are three different dining options and a state-of-the-art spa – all with breath-taking views. Children are made particularly welcome at this hotel. The Silo has been built in the grain elevator portion of the historic grain silo complex occupying six floors above what is now the Zeitz Museum of Contemporary Art Africa (MOCAA). The Silo Hotel is the final addition to The Royal Portfolio’s luxury, quintessentially South African experiences. From the outside, the greatest visible change to the building’s original structure is the addition of pillowed glazing panels, inserted into the geometry of the hotel floors, which bulge outward as if gently inflated. By night, this transforms the building into a glowing lantern or beacon in the harbour. https://www.theroyalportfolio.com/the-silo/overview/
hotspot.title: The Silo Hotel

hotspot.description: A city hotel for those who are connected to a world of art, music and fashion, as is evident in the décor of this truly different hotel. There are 252 studios and suites from which to choose, and they offer guests a wide range of comforts and amenities. Interesting artworks adorn the entire interior of the hotel. It has excellent views of the ocean, the Waterfront itself and Table Mountain. The famous Oui Bar and Kitchen will delight visitors with truly original fare and daily specials and is a regular stop for those interested in the city’s resurgent food scene. The Red Roof is a celebrated early-to-late hangout with astonishing views much loved by visitors and locals alike – this is the place if you feel like a sundowner or an early-morning yoga session. https://www.radissonhotels.com/en-us/hotels/radisson-red-cape-town-va-waterfront
hotspot.title: Radisson RED Hotel V&A Waterfront Cape Town

hotspot.description: Situated alongside the V&A Waterfront and within walking distance of all the entertainment and restaurants the area has to offer, this historical hotel gives visitors a bird’s eye view of the restored harbour, the bay and the mountain. The affordable and modern-day accommodation in 191 rooms is comfortable – a far cry from when the building housed a prison in the nineteenth century. There are standard rooms, business suites and family units. The Stonebreakers Restaurant offers both buffet and a la carte menus (including halaal options) as well a breathtaking view of the mountain. Apart from well-equipped rooms and suites, there are also four lounges, a gym, a spa, 18 conference venues, a business centre and 24-hour secure parking. The management and staff are particularly environmentally conscious, and this is apparent in the way they run this hotel. https://www.marriott.com/hotels/travel/cptbr-protea-hotel-cape-town-waterfront-breakwater-lodge
hotspot.title: Protea Hotel by Marriott Cape Town Waterfront Breakwater Lodge

hotspot.description: Between Robben Island and Table Mountain lies the luxurious and cosmopolitan Table Bay Hotel, right in the heart of the V&A Waterfront. This five-star 329-room hotel has one of the city’s most desired locations and is the epitome of sophistication and elegance. It is decorated in a very apt maritime style. It and continues to set its own standards in international service and cuisine, making it a favourite choice for both business and leisure travellers. From the hotel there are stunning views of the working harbour and Table Mountain, and guests also have direct access to the vast array of shops, restaurants and attractions of the Waterfront. On offer are all the services you would expect in a luxury hotel of this calibre, as well as a special travel desk for visitors, and a dedicated shuttle service providing transport to the airport and to the cable car at the foot of Table Mountain. There are also conferencing facilities and three different venues where functions can be hosted with the help of the highly professional staff. Be it business or pleasure, The Table Bay is a journey like no other. https://www.suninternational.com/table-bay/
hotspot.title: Table Bay Hotel

hotspot.description: This sophisticated and characterful venue, set right on the Pierhead of the V&A Waterfront, has sweeping views of the harbour, the city and the mountain. It was built in 1904 as the North Quay Warehouse, and converted in 1990 to a 94-room luxury hotel. It is popular with guests and there is a very good reason why it is often called ‘Your home in the heart of the Waterfront’. The ambience of colonial Cape Town is apparent as you step into the foyer, and historical touches abound, such as the information on various shipwrecks around the Cape coast. The hotel has two restaurants and a bar with outstanding views of the mountain and the harbour, as well as excellent spa facilities. It is renowned for its high level of service to both business and leisure travellers, and guests can make use of the travel consultancy, the valet service, a childminding service, a secretarial service and hotel transfer services. It is a favourite location for business and private functions. The superb harbour location puts guests right in the middle of all the attractions, shops and eateries of the Waterfront. https://newmarkhotels.com/places/hotels/victoria-alfred-hotel/
hotspot.title: Victoria & Alfred Hotel

hotspot.description: The Cape Grace Hotel has held pride of place on its own quay in the V&A Waterfront for the past 16 years, and it has maintained its reputation for ultimate style, luxury and excellent service in the perfect waterside setting. The stylish interiors have been inspried by Cape Town’s rich heritage and floral kingdom. Each of the 120 luxurious rooms offers 5-star luxury and extensive guest services are available, including a spa, a fitness studio, a restaurant, a bar (whisky, wine and cocktails), conference facilities and complementary transfers. Children of all ages are made to feel especially welcome. You can dine whenever it suits you, both inside or out. The superb international cuisine on offer is influenced by local flavours under executive chef, Malika van Reenen. Head-to-toe pampering is a speciality at the Spa at the Cape Grace. Another unique luxury is the Platandia Fine Jewellery Boutique, showcasing pieces fashioned from diamonds, platinum and tanzanite. Encircled by Table Mountain, the yacht marina, a working harbour and the bustling V&A Waterfront, there is no doubt that the Cape Grace is the ultimate Cape Town destination. https://www.capegrace.com/
hotspot.title: Cape Grace Hotel

hotspot.description: One&Only Cape Town displays the hallmarks of excellence found in all One&Only resorts around the world. It offers an unparalleled commitment to the finest experiences, attention to detail, luxurious accommodation, a wealth of activities and programmes, and state-of-the-art facilities. https://www.capetown.oneandonlyresorts.com/
hotspot.title: One&Only Cape Town

hotspot.description: At the gateway to the V&A Waterfront lies the 207-room City Lodge Hotel, which is known for its comfortable and reliable service. The hotel is within walking distance not only of the Waterfront’s main attractions, but also of the Central Business District of the Mother City. It has easy access to the N2 freeway and is only fifteen minutes by car from the Cape Town International Airport. Other facilities include a sundowner bar, a boardroom (for meetings and conferences), an internet café, a fitness room, wireless internet, fax and photocopy services, dry cleaning and a shuttle service. A very apt nautical theme is reflected in the hotel’s décor. https://clhg.com/
hotspot.title: City Lodge

hotspot.description: DID YOU KNOW? The Cape Wheel is a giant observation wheel that offers a spectacular 360 panoramic view of Cape Town from the vibrant V&A Waterfront precinct. Your viewing experience across the Mother City includes Table Mountain, Robben Island, Cape Town City skyline, Paarl Mountains, and the Cape Town Stadium. WOW! The Cape Wheel offers 30 fully enclosed air conditioned cabins that will take you 40 metres above the ground in safety and comfort on the four revolution ride. https://capewheel.co.za/
hotspot.title: The Cape Wheel

hotspot.description: Stylish mall with upscale shops, including jewelry & art stores, plus casual dining & scenic views.
hotspot.title: Clock Tower Retail Centre

hotspot.description: Vibrant, multi-level complex with vendors for local gourmet goods & international street food. https://www.waterfront.co.za/markets/va-food-market/
hotspot.title: V&A Food Market

hotspot.description: Over 150 shops for locally designed goods, including crafts, offered in a cool, industrial space. https://www.waterfront.co.za/area/watershed/
hotspot.title: The Watershed

hotspot.description: Vast complex of homes, businesses, restaurants, shops & an art museum on a historic working harbor.
hotspot.title: V&A Waterfront

hotspot.description: Weekly farmers' market offering produce, breads, eggs & dairy products, plus artisanal foods. https://ozcf.co.za/market-day/
hotspot.title: Oranjezicht City Farm Market

hotspot.description: Innovative exhibits & installations by African artists showcased in a redesigned grain silo. http://zeitzmocaa.museum/
hotspot.title: Zeitz Museum of Contemporary Art Africa

hotspot.description: Time travel to Cape Town 300 years ago... Visitors are invited to don an 18th Century tricorn hat and step below sea-level for fascinating perspectives of the 17th to 19th Century Cape Town. https://www.chavonnesbattery.co.za/
hotspot.title: Chavonnes Battery Museum

hotspot.description: The Victorian Gothic-style Clock Tower is an icon of the old Cape Town harbour. It was the original Port Captain's Office built in 1882. The pointed Gothic windows surrounds the structure with a clock, imported from Edinburgh, as a main feature. The red walls are the same colour as they were in the 1800's, having been carefully matched to scrapings of the original paint.
hotspot.title: Clock Tower Waterfront

hotspot.description: The South African Maritime Museum is a major attraction at the V&A Waterfront in Cape Town. It features floating exhibits such as the SAS Somerset (the world's last surviving boom defense ship) and the Alwyn Vincent (a steam tug) both of which are moored at the V&A waterfront. https://www.westerncape.gov.za/facility/sa-maritime-centre
hotspot.title: South African Maritime Museum

hotspot.description: Boutique mall with access to various Jewelry and Galleries.
hotspot.title: Alfred Mall

hotspot.description: ​Test your strategic skills and mental dexterity on this giant outdoor chess board. The space created for chess forms part of the V&A Waterfront’s development strategy to energise the space between buildings by creating vibrant spaces in which locals of all ages can relax. But chess is by no means the only thing on offer – there is also a boules court (a French form of bowls played on rough ground), and several smaller chess games built into the outdoor tables for a more intimate game. For the kids there is Kids Ahoy Playground in the square. And for those who want to sit and watch the world go by while being entertained, face painters, stilt walkers a marimba band and balloon sculptors provide an air of festivity.
hotspot.title: Pier Head Chess Board

hotspot.description: Modern indoor aquarium & conservation center offering close encounters with sharks & penguins. https://www.aquarium.co.za/
hotspot.title: Two Oceans Aquarium

hotspot.description: Embark on a fully guided tour to South Africa’s famous World Heritage Site: walk in the footsteps of Nelson Mandela, tour the island’s rich fauna and flora treasures, visit the lime quarry where the political prisoners worked, and see the village where former warders lived. The standard tour to Robben Island is 3.5 hours long, including the two half-hour ferry rides. The ferries can carry 150 people and they depart four times per day, weather permitting, from the V&A Waterfront in Cape Town. The Robben Island Tour includes: • A return boat trip across Table Bay • A visit to the infamous aaximum security prison • Interaction with an ex-political prisoner • A 45-minute bus ride with a guide who provides commentary • The opportunity to explore the Murray’s Bay Harbour precinct attractions, such as the Muslim shrine, or kramat, and the museum shop. http://robben-island.org.za/
hotspot.title: Robben Island Museum

hotspot.description: Battery Park is a new urban park that forms the gateway to the V&A Waterfront. When it is completed in October 2018, it will integrate Cape Town’s CBD and the V&A Waterfront through a series of pedestrian routes, including one alongside the canal. Visitors to the park will also be able to engage in a range of outdoor recreation, entertainment and retail activities in various levels of public spaces. The 12,000 m2 (approx. 1.2 hectare) park forms part of the V&A Waterfront’s Canal District and can be accessed from either Dock Road, Fort Road, Ebenezer Road or Alfred Street. A four-story public parking facility is constructed beneath the park with entrances via Alfred Street or Dock Road. When it is complete the parking facility will offer 1206 bays for public, residential and tenant use. https://www.waterfront.co.za/battery-park-waterfront/
hotspot.title: The V&A Battery Park
Discover all there is to see | V&A Waterfront

hotspot.description: Robben Island is an island in Table Bay, 6.9 kilometres west of the coast of Bloubergstrand, Cape Town, South Africa. It takes its name from the Dutch word for seals, hence the Dutch/Afrikaans name Robbeneiland which translates to Seal Island. http://www.robben-island.org.za/
hotspot.title: Robben Island

hotspot.description: Devil's Peak is part of the mountainous backdrop to Cape Town, South Africa. When looking at Table Mountain from the city centre, or when looking at the standard picture postcard view of the mountain, the skyline is from left to right: the spire of Devil's Peak, the flat mesa of Table Mountain, the dome of Lion's Head and Signal Hill.
hotspot.title: Devil's Peak

hotspot.description: Did you know: The original docks, now the site of the V&A Waterfront, were South Africa's first link with modern industrialisation. We have 22 original historical landmarks that illustrate this rich and fascinating history.
hotspot.title: Old Waterfront

hotspot.description: In 1996 Ben and Judy Filmalter opened the first Mugg & Bean at the V&A Waterfront in Cape Town. Now it is in a stunning new location, overlooking the harbour. The essence of this coffee shop is about generosity, and welcoming and friendly service. So whatever it is you feel like – an aromatic single origin coffee break, a deliciously filling breakfast, lunch or dinner, or a slice of one of our freshly baked, made-from-scratch cakes, you will experience the Mugg & Bean difference. This coffee shop is known for its generous portions, its warm welcome and as the place where you always get more and more. https://muggandbean.co.za/
hotspot.title: Mugg & Bean

hotspot.description:
Jetty 1 Museum is just another nondescript building on the V&A Waterfront. Look more closely and you’ll see a small board next to the entrance, explaining that the building served as a passageway for everyone traveling to and from Robben Island during apartheid. For the prisoners, staff, and wardens, this was the last place they could see Cape Town before their ferry pulled away from the mainland and the city disappeared into the dark silhouette of Table Mountain.
Now a small museum, Jetty 1 houses information about the history of Robben Island, both before and after apartheid.This is a must-see if you don’t have time to do the full Robben Island tour but are still curious about this time in Cape Town’s history.
hotspot.title: Jetty 1 Museum

hotspot.description: There are a wide variety of attractions and activities to enjoy on the property. From cultural landmarks, to art to more leisurely pursuits such as a helicopter tours and sunset cruise on one of the chartered boats berthed here. https://www.waterfront.co.za/leisure/attractions/
hotspot.title: Attractions

hotspot.description: Our Story is about a dream… a dream to share our passion for good food with you. A dream of building a family of restaurants where people don’t need to board a plane to experience Mozambique. A destination where no passport is required! Based on the authentic Mozambique “Barraca” which, in English means “hut”. In Mozambique – in a home or on the street – eating, drinking and chilling is a way of life that is captured in a “Barraca”. This is Mo-Zam-Bik! Exceptionally flavoured food and a good vibe! An Education to live and let live! So that’s what we have created… a chill zone reminiscent of hot sunshine, white sands, prawns and beer! Muito Obrigado!!! https://www.mozambik.co.za/
hotspot.title: Mozambik

hotspot.description: Harbour House at the V&A Waterfront offers fine dining in a gorgeous setting. With wonderful glass walls encasing the tables you can enjoy the vibe of the Waterfront while you feast on world-class cuisine. The setting is elegant and simple, with the perfect backdrop of the Cape Town harbour. https://www.harbourhouse.co.za/functions/
hotspot.title: Harbour House

hotspot.description: Sevruga is one of Cape Town’s premium dining establishments, and it offers patrons both superb dining and a sophisticated atmosphere. The menu caters for a wide variety of tastes, ranging from modest meals to taste sensations, which offer more intricate and complex flavours. Perfection is difficult to achieve, but the staff at this restaurant do everything they can to exceed your expectations. In short, Sevruga offers an excellent wine list and exquisite dining in an elegant atmosphere. https://www.sevruga.co.za/
hotspot.title: Sevruga

hotspot.description: Busking is performance art that takes place on the street for voluntary donations – and is practiced all over the world. Contributing to the vibrant atmosphere, it has been an integral part of the V&A Waterfront since inception, some 30 years ago. At The V&A Waterfront however, the busking programme is more than just performing for tips. It is an entrepreneurship development and incubation programme, focused on all types of performers; from musicians and magicians, to freestyle footballers and mime’s alike. The main goal of the programme is to create a platform for young performers to develop their craft and become successful entrepreneurs.
hotspot.title: V&A Busker Spot

hotspot.description: DID YOU KNOW? The Cape Big Wheel is a giant observation wheel that offers a spectacular 360 panoramic view of Cape Town from the vibrant V&A Waterfront precinct. Your viewing experience across the Mother City includes Table Mountain, Robben Island, Cape Town City skyline, Paarl Mountains, and the Cape Town Stadium. WOW! The Cape Wheel offers 30 fully enclosed air conditioned cabins that will take you 40 metres above the ground in safety and comfort on the four revolution ride.
hotspot.title: The Cape Big Wheel

hotspot.description: The Amphitheatre at the Waterfront provides a great central spot for live entertainment. The amphitheatre is centrally located, and there are various fast food restaurant as well as sit-down restaurant in the surrounding area. The harbour is a short walk away and table mountain is in full view. The whole area is connected with free wifi.
hotspot.title: The Amphitheatre
Hakuna Matata - Hassan'Adas | Cape Town Jazzathon 2020 Festival Live Performance
Zakhele Popo - Buskers at the V&A Waterfront

hotspot.description: At Quay Four you can choose between the terrace right on the quayside (Quay Four Tavern) with its hearty food, and the elegant upstairs restaurant where the emphasis is on fresh seafood: choose between lobster, the line fish of the day, or the incredible seafood platter. The à la carte menu also includes a great feast of irresistible meat and poultry dishes. Not only does Quay Four pride themselves on their superior quality food, but also on the very high calibre of service that is offered by the professional waitrons. https://quay4.co.za/
hotspot.title: Quay 4 Tavern

hotspot.description: Union Castle Building houses the South African Maritime Museum. Built in 1919 for Union Castle Mail Steamship Company the building houses the South African Maritime Museum today. The museum showcases the maritime history of Table Bay and houses the largest collection of model ships in South Africa.
hotspot.title: Union Castle Building

hotspot.description: The NSRI boathouse is an all glass boathouse, designed by Rob Meek. The boathouse is located on the very same slipway where the first port lifeboat was housed in 1898. The glass boathouse has exceptional architecture holding up the glass panels and the building won an award for its design. The adjacent slipway continues to be used for the overhaul of wooden fishing boats.
hotspot.title: The NSRI boathouse

hotspot.description: This sophisticated and characterful venue, set right on the Pierhead of the V&A Waterfront, has sweeping views of the harbour, the city and the mountain. It was built in 1904 as the North Quay Warehouse, and converted in 1990 to a 94-room luxury hotel. It is popular with guests and there is a very good reason why it is often called ‘Your home in the heart of the Waterfront’. The ambience of colonial Cape Town is apparent as you step into the foyer, and historical touches abound, such as the information on various shipwrecks around the Cape coast. The hotel has two restaurants and a bar with outstanding views of the mountain and the harbour, as well as excellent spa facilities. It is renowned for its high level of service to both business and leisure travellers, and guests can make use of the travel consultancy, the valet service, a childminding service, a secretarial service and hotel transfer services. It is a favourite location for business and private functions. The superb harbour location puts guests right in the middle of all the attractions, shops and eateries of the Waterfront. https://newmarkhotels.com/places/hotels/victoria-alfred-hotel/
hotspot.title: Victoria & Alfred Hotel

hotspot.description: Did you know? The Victoria & Alfred Hotel was originally a warehouse
hotspot.title: The Victoria &Alfred Hotel

hotspot.description: Situated on the ground level at the entrance to the Victoria Wharf, Café Alfredo spills out onto the Pierhead where inviting tables welcome guests. The friendly, relaxed setting combined with Euro-café styled food makes this café a winner any time of the day. Most of the seating is outdoors and it overlooks the pedestrian thoroughfare where musicians, dancers and singers entertain the crowds. The café serves breakfast, lunch and dinner. Pop in for coffee, cake or a meal, and watch the world go by. https://cafe-alfredo.business.site/
hotspot.title: Café Alfredo

hotspot.description: This exciting new addition to the V&A Waterfront is located in the old Hildebrand Building, which has breathtaking harbour and mountain views. The menu is authentic Portuguese cuisine with a distinct Mozambican flair. Dishes include favourites such as peri-peri chicken, trinchado and espetadas, which can be enjoyed with a glass of Vinho Tinto. There is also an emphasis on shellfish such as langoustines, crayfish and so-called LM prawns. With its carefully planned layout, design and an enticing menu, MAReSOL has quickly become a firm favourite among visitors to the Waterfront. http://mar-e-sol.co.za/
hotspot.title: MAReSOL

hotspot.description: The light and bright space that is now the Life Grand Café started life as a Post Office in 1902. The setting is comfortable and chic, and the interior design intriguing, modern, but respectful of the historical elements contained in the building. The delicious food is Mediterranean-inspired, and the menu contains many comfortable classics – often with a twist. https://lifegrandcafe.com/
hotspot.title: Life Grand Cafe

hotspot.description: The name of this restaurant is Belgian, the setting is spectacular, and the ambience is international. Situated on the quayside of Cape Town’s V&A Waterfront, Den Anker, now in its 24th year of operation, offers patrons exceptional seafood and other creatively prepared dishes. Enjoy the views from the terrace, or from inside the restaurant, where floor-to-ceiling windows enable you to appreciate just how spectacular Table Mountain can look from this vantage point. The restaurant is also known for its beer tastings and its exclusive Anker Brew– many of the beers on offer are imported from small Belgian breweries. With attentive staff, some tasty local South African specialities, and delicious desserts on the menu, a meal at Den Anker is bound to be memorable. http://denanker.co.za/
hotspot.title: Den Anker

hotspot.description: La Parada offers tapas and specialises in sharing small plates. With an eclectic Spanish-infused interior. La Parada offers tapas born from Spanish heritage and specialises in sharing small plates that are curated for the South African palate. With an eclectic Spanish-infused interior, La Parada promises delicious adventurous dishes served in a stylish yet easy environment. https://laparada.co.za/waterfront/
hotspot.title: La Parada

hotspot.description: This sophisticated and characterful venue, set right on the Pierhead of the V&A Waterfront, has sweeping views of the harbour, the city and the mountain.It was built in 1904 as the North Quay Warehouse, and converted in 1990 to a 94-room luxury hotel. It is popular with guests and there is a very good reason why it is often called ‘Your home in the heart of the Waterfront’. The ambience of colonial Cape Town is apparent as you step into the foyer, and historical touches abound, such as the information on various shipwrecks around the Cape coast. The hotel has two restaurants and a bar with outstanding views of the mountain and the harbour, as well as excellent spa facilities. It is renowned for its high level of service to both business and leisure travellers, and guests can make use of the travel consultancy, the valet service, a childminding service, a secretarial service and hotel transfer services. It is a favourite location for business and private functions. The superb harbour location puts guests right in the middle of all the attractions, shops and eateries of the Waterfront. https://www.vahotel.co.za/

Ginja is situated on the Pierhead in the Waterfront and is a stone’s throw from the water’s edge. There are superb views across the Waterfront to Table Mountain. This chic restaurant offers a wholesome and delicious menu, with a wide variety of options from a range of cuisine styles – from risottos, to wraps, seafood, salads and sandwiches. It’s the perfect spot to dine out, to pop in for a snack, go for a cup of coffee, or meet friends for sundowners. https://newmarkhotels.com/places/restaurants/ginja/
hotspot.title: Ginja
Performers at V & A Waterfront, Cape Town, South Africa

hotspot.description:
Claudette Schreuders - 2018
Oversized bronzes by Claudette Schreuders represent the four South African Nobel Peace Laureates: The late Nkosi Albert Luthuli, Archbishop Emeritus Desmond Tutu, former State President FW de Klerk and former President Nelson Mandela.
hotspot.title: Nobel Square

hotspot.description: The V&A Food Market is South Africa’s latest and most tantalising street food experience. Here you can meander through the stalls and taste many delicious treats. Experience an adventure of flavours in this authentic market environment, where you can choose between local gourmet foods and international street food. Have a craft beer, sip a cappuccino, or even have an ice cream. There’s something for the whole family. http://waterfrontfoodmarket.com/
hotspot.title: V&A Food Market

hotspot.description: Did you know: This used to be a Power Station long before it became the V&A Food Market?
hotspot.title: Old Power Station

hotspot.description:
Noria Mabasa - 2018
This complex bronze sculpture by Noria Mabasa, is a work acknowledging the contribution of women and children to the attainment of peace in South Africa.
hotspot.title: Peace and Democracy

hotspot.description: The marina that is now home to expensive yachts was the original quarry where criminals dug up the stones used to build the Waterfront.
hotspot.title: The Marina

hotspot.description: Did you know: Robinson Dry Dock dates back to 20 October 1882 and is the oldest working dry dock in the Southern Hemisphere.
hotspot.title: Robinson Dry Dock

hotspot.description: Test your strategic skills and mental dexterity on this giant outdoor chess board. The space created for chess forms part of the V&A Waterfront’s development strategy to energise the space between buildings by creating vibrant spaces for visitors of all ages to relax and enjoy the breathtaking views.

The African Trading Port offers a wide variety of some of the finest examples of African art around. Works of art from many different African countries and cultures are on display here. ATP has been housed in their current location in the Old Port Captain’s Building at Cape Town’s Waterfront since 2001. Over the last few decades, much time has been devoted to sourcing art from successive generations of African artists. There is a wide array of objects d’art including sculpture, artefacts, ceramics, pottery, bronze-ware and glassware. Although the collection focuses on the work of recognised artists, display space is also devoted to some of the younger, emerging artists from the African continent. http://www.africantradingport.co.za
hotspot.title: The African Trading Port

hotspot.description: Enjoy delicious seafood and sushi. It is the ideal venue for bringing a group of friends or the family, or going on a special date, or having a business lunch. The menu brings together the best of South African and Japanese cuisine – from fish & chips to classic sashimi. When it comes to seafood, it doesn’t get any fresher. The restaurant also caters for meat-eaters and vegetarians and offers a carefully selected range of the finest South African wines. Whether you’re in the mood for a quick sushi lunch, a romantic lobster dinner or drinks with the crew, a visit to the Cape Town Fish market will be a memorable experience. https://www.ctfm.co.za/waterfront/
hotspot.title: Cape Town Fish Market

hotspot.description: Via Vittoria (Italian for a place serving wine and food) where one feels comfortable enjoying a casual affordable family dinner of pizza & pasta with a carafe of house wine or dining on shellfish, fresh fish & veal with corporate clients. https://via-vittoria-waterfront.business.site/
hotspot.title: Via Vittoria

hotspot.description: The Clock Tower was built in 1882 and still features the original clock and tidal gauge mechanisms and a mirror room.
hotspot.title: The Clock Tower

hotspot.description: The Chavonnes Battery dating back to circa 1725. The old remnants have form part of a museum in the Clocktower District. The battery forms part of fortifications constructed by the Dutch, and they the oldest historic relic in the V&A.
hotspot.title: The Chavonnes Battery

source.url: media/25 Narrator - Seal Landing & Robben Island.mp3

hotspot.description: Inspired by the street cafés of Portugal, and infused with the vivacious energy of the people of Africa, Vida e Caffè is passionate about their coffee. Based on the fare typical of a street in Lisbon, Vida e Caffè allows you to enjoy a cup of Europe in Africa. A passion for perfection means this cafè always strives to serve the best espresso and espresso-based caffè beverages possible. https://vidaecaffe.com/
hotspot.title: Vida E Café

hotspot.description: The Kapstadt Brauhaus offers a menu of traditional German cuisine, including eisbein, schnitzels, pretzels, German sausages and alpine pizza. Patrons can also pull in for a pint of one of the many local and international beers on offer. The restaurant has ample seating inside and outside, with beautiful views of the harbour. https://www.kapstadtbrauhaus.co.za/
hotspot.title: Kapstadt Brauhaus

hotspot.description:
Katharien De Villiers - 2019
Engaging with the diversity of the Cape Town public space, I have been driven to find a way of making art approachable and unique in its experience. A(non) is an installation crafted to un-inhabit the space. The the use of material and kinetic qualities activated by the viewer implies that the work can only fully be experienced when viewers are participating. Each viewer will experience the work differently allowing the work to transform in meaning and nature. The work which absorbs, reflects and produces light is a meditative allowance – a time-out zone as a moment to escape, reboot and re-centre for both big and little. There is something magical about light activated by touch, and one becomes particularly aware in interacting with A(non). The works stand as shrines or sanctuaries in their collective solitudes. Strange domes to step under and be transported into a different galaxy within which the experience is entirely your own. A(non) is a seductive, playful and mesmerising piece, designed for a universal platform of experience and understanding- something I believe there is much to little of.
hotspot.title: a (non) | everything your heart desires

hotspot.description:
Cameron Platter - 2015
Cameron Platter was the Zeitz MOCAA Art in Public Places Artist in Residence for 2015. On these five planters he has added an ironic twist to the busyness that happens in this district. Look closely at the faux Ndembele design and you will make out the words “NEED MONEY”.
hotspot.title: MONEY/POEMS/DANCERS

hotspot.description: Did you know: The Grain Silo complex was built in 1921, has been redeveloped into the Zeitz Museum of Contemporary Art Africa (MOCAA).
hotspot.title: Grain Silo

hotspot.description:
Victor Ehikamenor- 2016
Isimagodo - The unkowable is the mystery and core essence of an ancient masquerade that is only known to the initiates of Esanland in Edo State, Nigeria. Growing up, Isimagodoas a masquearde was a complex enigmatic phenomenon for the artist to understand The sculpture is a metophor of that childhood larger than life phantasmagoric memory. The artist has also come to see his succesive governments as Isimagodo, something he cannot quite understand despite their existence.
hotspot.title: Isimagodo
V&A Father's Day Motor Show Highlights

hotspot.description: Innovative exhibits & installations by African artists showcased in a redesigned grain silo. http://zeitzmocaa.museum/
hotspot.title: Zeitz Museum of Contemporary Art Africa

hotspot.description: The Lindt Chocolate Boutique & Studio offers customers the full Lindt product range (which includes pralines and macaroons) as well as an opportunity to attend chocolate classes. At this studio, chocolate enthusiasts can participate in a variety of exciting classes presented by Lindt master chocolatiers, and gain insight into the secret world of chocolate. https://chocolatestudio.co.za/
hotspot.title: LINDT Chocolate Studio

hotspot.description:
Kyle Morland - 2015
This abstract sculpture challenges us to find form, beauty and meaning in something that is not obviously recognizable. Abstraction has been a driving force in sculpture since the 20th Century. For thousands of years, sculpture’s main role was to commemorate the subject, the sitter, and represent their position in society. Abstract sculptors free themselves from the constraints of the represented and indulge in the technical language of sculpture itself: Form, shape, space, weight, material, colour, composition, line, texture, tone, contrast and scale etc.
hotspot.title: Falsework IV

hotspot.description: The food is Euro-Asian with an Indian twist, and there are chalkboard specials and a buffet from which to choose. The options range from fine dining to casual café meals and on offer is also a selection of fine chocolates, preserves, cheeses and a charcuterie in the delis section. Every day there is something different to explore, whether you are dining or shopping – or both. https://www.theyardatsilo.co.za/
hotspot.title: The Yard

hotspot.description:
Sanell Aggenbach - 2019
Sanell Aggenbach’s artwork Young Sailors whimsically combines the idea of Maritime exploration and the adventure inherent in a child’s sense of play and imagination. Using the motif of an origami paper boat that has been up-scaled and designed to hold child passengers, Aggenbach has combined her artistic skill with Manuel Mendes, one of the Waterfront’s long-time boat builders. In Young Sailors Aggenbach has created an elegant and charming metaphor alluding to the V&A as a functioning harbour but also as a space of play and possibility in it’s role as a home for world-class art and design.
Born in Cape Town in 1975, Aggenbach currently lives and works in Woodstock, Cape Town. Her explorative work has secured her many achievements. She is represented in numerous public and private collections, including Sasol, Absa, Spier, SABC, Red Bull (Austria), the South African National Gallery, 21C Museum in Kentucky (USA) and Anglo Gold.
hotspot.title: Young Sailors

hotspot.description:
Gavin Young - 2018
This playful but monumental bronze and wood sculpture plays with shape and form. It references Paul Cezanne’s concept that we see, or should see, the world through schematized shapes and geometric simplification.
hotspot.title: Ice-cream Cone and Blue Cheese

hotspot.description: At this stylish tapas spot in the Silo District, you will find traditional hearth-style cooking with a broad selection of grills. On the menu are whole vegetables, fish and meats, accompanied by freshly prepared flatbreads baked in a state-of-the-art wood-fired pizza oven. It’s about sharing, tasting and feasting on a variety of flavourful dishes made using ethical, locally sourced ingredients. It’s an eating experience for the relaxed gourmand – with a well-stocked bar and televisions for sports enthusiasts thrown in. http://sicantinasociale.co.za/
hotspot.title: Si Cantina – Sociale

hotspot.description: Southern Guild is the sole gallery representing locally made collectible design in Africa. It commissions South Africa’s leading designers to create their most groundbreaking work, setting new benchmarks of quality and originality for the design industry at large. The gallery holds regular exhibitions of contemporary furniture, lighting, ceramics, sculpture and jewellery that have redefined perceptions of African design and established the gallery as a relevant and ground-breaking player in the global design arena. The gallery itself is a dynamic, curated space hosting exhibitions that change every two to three months. New shows are mounted alongside a regularly updated showroom of available works and a store selling our own collection of designer products. https://southernguild.co.za/
hotspot.title: Southern Guild

hotspot.description:
Marco Cianfanelli - 2019
Marco Cianfanelli’s previous explorations of the human brain as form, find new dimension in an exploratory series of digitally altered brain-like objects. At the base of our brain, we hold the primal information of our ancestry; it is the living mechanism by which we are innately linked to our past. The faceted forms of the object are geometric distillations of the brain’s vast, organic topography. The geometric brain is a symbol that embodies the human desire to identify categorically and represent symbolically, an unquantifiable flux of information. Condensing the intricacy of the organ into reduced, geometric forms allows it to adopt the appearance of a Paleolithic stone implement. In its materiality, the form points to a duality between progress and destruction inherent in technological advancement. More than implement, the form is an artifact of the present and whether viewed as a large feature in the landscape, or an implement of survival, it conjures the past and hypothesizes a future trajectory. It speaks to the collection of significant historical artifacts and marks our technological evolution, locating us in time and suggesting that our greatest and yet most dangerous tool is, in fact, our brain.
hotspot.title: Cerebral Aspects
